posts.subject: ANTI SPAM MEASURES ACTIVATED
posts.body:
==I AM ATTEMPTING TO DISABLE SELF-GENERATED CERTIFICATES==

You can go to ZeroID at http://127.0.0.1:43110/1iD5ZQJMNXu43w1qLB8sfdHVKppVMduGz/ to generate a new cert. Switch to that cert in the 0 menu on the right and use it to resume posting.

Note that this will lock you to one cert.

Consider installing Veracrypt and running Zeronet from a large encrypted file to protect yourself.

Board owners can use their old cert for admin functions, but will need their ZeroID cert for posting.

posts.subject: Administrator here.
posts.body: Checking in on updates.  How are you anons coming along with the bugs?

posts.subject: Administrator here.
posts.body:
I had every reason to believe that anons would be diligent about filtering illegal content (and they have been).  That being the case it was basically irrelevant if you were using TOR or not.  

That being said, I've been proven wrong.  We've garnered enough attention that we have Leftist rags investigating our IP records for purposes unknown. 

I'm working on a solution to ZeroID but it will take time.  /tech/ is also working on figuring out how to port upgrades over from the site that I took 08's base code from without breaking what we have.

Use TOR or a VPN for posting.  I find VPN much faster, personally.  And please seed.  Most of the Q people seem to have been scared off, which has dropped our recurrent connections and sped the site up, but every little bit helps.

posts.subject: Administrator here.

Some version of it will be permanent, but I'm looking into a native solution.  Something like a once-a-day limit on getting a new cert from 08chan itself.

We're going to start looking at upgrades seriously now, since we may be here for a while.

==Edit:  I just set content.json allowed as a downloadable filetype for all certs.  Update the site and reload and see if this fixes it.==

posts.subject: Administrator here.
posts.body:
>>d1f32513-9192-447f-af02-cef31a3c780e

So I think what is happening is this:

>Assume we start with a fresh Zeronet install
>You have to get a ZeroID
>When you load the site the first time, it loads all posts and content '''that have a valid cert'''
>Since the site only accepts ZeroID certs, only content posted with a ZeroID cert is downloaded and saved
>So the site looks empty

I need to find a way to enable only ZeroID certs for posting, but allow anyone to READ content that was posted with 08chan certs.  Then when you reload, it should pull everything and update.


This was fucking with me bad because the site looked fine.  As the local machine, all content was showing up no matter which cert I was using.  Now I have a way to see whats happening.  I also tried to fix and update the announcements (which I thought I did yesterday, but I couldn't see that it didn't publish).  There is some way to manipulate the master /users/content.json file to make this work, I'm sure of it.  I just need to figure out the right commands and syntax.

Edit:  We aren't the only ones with this problem, either.  Millchan used to be a LOT bigger.  I deleted them to make room to put my Zeronet folder where I wanted it, and when it reloaded the site is much smaller.  This has to do with them updating their own system sometime back, I'm sure.

I have some ideas and I'll be working on it all weekend.  I get off work early tomorrow and you'll see me here.

posts.subject: Administrator here.
posts.body:
>>7d54e1f7-ec39-41c3-abdd-ff6b52126a7b
I know it isn't.  I tried to whitelist old content by altering a file to make a special content.json file read-only downloadable.  It didn't work.  In order to post about it I did it through the old 08chan cert by switching back to the spammable system for a few minutes.  I'm not surprised the post vanished when I switched back to ZeroID.

The perma-fix for this will be to basically copy ZeroID's functions into 08chan's cert generation.  So you visit 08chan once over the clearnet, get a cert, and then go back to TOR and/or VPN and be good to go.  I want to configure it so that it resets once per day, so that anons can still dump their old certs and "post histories" daily if they like.

>>37919ac3-7b82-4ef5-845c-712c7f4023b1
I think you're correct, but in a different sense than what I'm wanting to do.  All the original users have the full data of 08chan, its just that new certs aren't downloading it.  It should be possible to let everyone get a copy of everything and then proceed forward with only ZeroID (or 08chanID if it can be implemented) from there on.

I understand your reaction, but I've got to strike a balance between fixing the issues in a timely manner, doing it at an hour that will inconvenience the least people, and sleeping and working.  

The anon above seems to have an unexpected positive result, and I'll want to look at it later to figure out why he's seeing something different than what I expected.

posts.subject: Administrator here.
posts.body:
>>bff2fc96-64e2-4cea-a9d8-973e86d6a951
>But I don't understand why they are being accepted by other machines without a valid ZeroID certificate. Maybe ZeroNet is smart enough to know if the file to be copied is the content.json, then it can read the same content.json to determine permissions, possibly before it even exists locally?

Its not that smart, its that DUMB.  I changed the master content file for the site itself to load both 08chan and ZeroID.bit signed content, and forced an update to all users.  I'm betting Zeronet only cares that you have a valid cert for adding NEW content at the time you post to the network, and will otherwise just ''download and display'' whatever saved content the master file tells it to.

Let's hope I'm right.
Edit:  Good night!

posts.subject: Administrator here.
posts.body:
>>912cc6aa-40f4-43d7-9317-b9213d7b8f41

So that suggests to me is that buried in the pile of spaghetti, probably js.all is code that is telling the system to only download content from authorized cert signers.  If we can find that code and add a whitelist exception for 08chan certs, while leaving them disabled for posting via users/content.json, that would be a fix.

>>0383347c-4705-4631-beb2-2ca7ef13dbba
08chan certs were temporarily enabled this afternoon for a while.  That could have been the cause.  Man this is a bug hunt.

>>2abbe6b7-75ba-444d-9526-b9d2f5f65616

Entirely possible as well.

There's a line of code in the main site/content.json that seems interesting too.  Take a look at the bottom.

[code]
"signers_sign": "G/Vir87KJu8I2eKRsrJuuPalh9TS4MjdwJbuah2j6O94VWIJ8ev/Uct6nDY622RTacB9JPL6KzNCUAD+Fnpu0jE=",
 "signs": {
  "1DdPHedr5Tz55EtQWxqvsbEXPdc4uCVi9D": "G2JiEt0f5SXOOtvbQbSdCd+3KSRm0rLbsvTmRDm4AQvdJpr7reEP4ueiVD6MHdzc3BXJ/sXQyY9MzKrqndW1+EQ="
 },
 "signs_required": 1,
 "title": "08chan",
 "translate": ["js/all.js"],
 "zeronet_version": "0.6.5"
[/code]

Specifically I wonder what would happen if signers_sign has both ZeroIDs and 08chans hashes set, and the number for "signs_required" was set to 2.

posts.subject: Administrator here.
Administrator here.
posts.body:
>>fbf4b991-afcb-4670-8a34-00cbc1b62c6e
ZeroID relies on your IP address to generate your cert.  Even if you're on a VPN, you might've just accidentally hit one that was already used.  Get a new IP via any of the normal methods and try again.

>>90b0dc52-ceea-4886-bd15-7b2a0725de3c

>>523f8b86-a3e8-449f-bf72-4d506052b12d
Investigating this now.

posts.subject: Administrator here.
posts.body:
>>523f8b86-a3e8-449f-bf72-4d506052b12d

I see a couple problems with this.  

[code]"address": "1DdPHedr5Tz55EtQWxqvsbEXPdc4uCVi9D",
 "files": {},
 "ignore": ".*",
 "inner_path": "data/users/content.json",
 "modified": 1565559740,
 "signs": {
  "1DdPHedr5Tz55EtQWxqvsbEXPdc4uCVi9D": "G1uS6+pOFmJaJ4HO3gHsf9u67XZVRWTg+MzFurTUBduFF0PIV24221GmfJBVt/AOvZe4Dep0ckMKCL63cuw7Xwo="
 },
 "user_contents": {
  "cert_signers": {
   "zeroid.bit": ["1iD5ZQJMNXu43w1qLB8sfdHVKppVMduGz"],
   "08chan": ["1NwwLdiFBcVAA4jXQ712ZtQfDHEMvk8BiD"][/code]

See that line at the bottom listing 08chan under signers?  That line is what enabled self-signed certs from 08chan.  Thats what we need to turn off.

Edit:  That's what makes the other "fixes" deceptively hard.  Because that line was there, everything seemed to work until we realized that self-certs were still working.

Edit2:  Digging into it more, is this what you tried for a fix?

[code]"permission_rules": {
   ".*@08chan": {
    "max_size": 0,
    "files_allowed": "",
    "files_allowed_optional": ""[/code]

So you're enabling self-signed certs, but disabling their uploading of all file types and text, while pulling the msgpacks from the whitelist?

You know what, that might actually work.  I'll give it a shot.

posts.subject: Administrator here.
posts.body:
>>1a84f463-6b7c-434b-a555-9111e5bbde41
Negative.  It looks like an error in the syntax according to gedit.  The site throws me a UIwebsocket error and won't let me update content.json at all.  Note all the highlighted places.

>>564d8587-c4c1-4f37-acb6-5a5605ee24bb
I think I agree with you.  I only figured this place would be used for a day or two at most, and not in a super serious way.  Between the hitpieces, and FBI-kun and the level of collusion against 8chan, we don't need a bunker.  We need a fortress.  An alpine redoubt.

Help me as much as you can, because if you're down for it then so am I.

Edit:  Looks like the proper syntax is double backslashes?  This is how the main line for the cert signers is structured.
[code]    "files_allowed_optional": "(src\\/)?.{40}(-thumb)?\\.(png|jpeg|jpg|gif|webm|mp4|ogg|mp3|pdf|epub)(\\.piecemap\\.msgpack)?",[/code]

>>97d64e3a-18eb-41fe-ad08-e0113adb5369

If it helps, we never went back to just the 08chan certs when I had them enabled, only along side ZeroID because I didn't want anyone to get pissed trying to post while I was working on it.  I think you're onto something, with the "permissions" able to override the main code lines as exceptions.  Its worth a shot, right?

Trying to fix the syntax now.  gedit doesn't want to find and replace the \. characters for some reason, even with the file saved as text.  Stand by.

Edit.  Syntax errors fixed.  Deploying now.

posts.subject: Administrator here.
posts.body:
>>97d64e3a-18eb-41fe-ad08-e0113adb5369

I'd say let it propagate a bit and give her a try.

posts.subject: Administrator here.
posts.body:
It failed.  The users/content.json file didn't update the first time.  I closed Zeronet, edited it and restarted, and it threw this error when trying to sign and publish:

Content signing error
ValueError: Expecting property name: line 28 column 3 (char 862) in UiWebsocket.py line 457 > ContentManager.py line 636 > SiteStorage.py line 307 > __init__.py line 291 > __init__.py line 339 > decoder.py line 364 > decoder.py line 380

Posting contents of each:

UIWebsocket.py:  
[code]            site.content_manager.sign(inner_path, privatekey, extend=extend, update_changed_files=update_changed_files, remove_missing_optional=remove_missing_optional)[/code]

contentmanager.py
[code] if self.site.storage.isFile(inner_path):
                content = self.site.storage.loadJson(inner_path)[/code]

sitestorage.py
[code] # Load and parse json file
    def loadJson(self, inner_path):
        with self.open(inner_path) as file:
            return json.load(file)[/code]

init.py (there are many files with this name in nearly every directory)
decoder.py:  Cant find a relevant line in any of them.  Only 1 is big enough to get to 364 lines, and the line is a blank space.

posts.subject: Administrator here.
posts.body:
>>6e0d61b6-e7e3-4bb8-b61d-a25780d11953

If you're downloading a big chunk of the site in the background as on a fresh install, sometimes the torrent trackers will block you for too much traffic.  If that happens, your post won't go through as it'll fail to publish to other users.

Do a single post test over the clearnet with the current users/content.json  and see what it does.

posts.subject: Administrator here.
posts.body:
~~I GOT IT TO GO THROUGH AND PUBLISH~~

Scratch that.  The error caused it to pull the "last good" content.json from the network and replace itself.  Trying to force it again threw the same error posted above.

Its looking for something in line 10898 of the users/content.json file that UIwebsocket.py and other files are trying to call.  Are we missing an argument?  Or a filepath, maybe?

posts.subject: Administrator here.
posts.body:
>>3fdc4a67-a7bb-4164-b541-0caffda223cd

So I edit the file in gedit, save it, and then reload ZeroNet.  I come to 08chan and it throws an error.  When that happens, it seems the network can overwrite my users/content.json with the last "good" version.  I can force it by editing the file again and saving it while ZeroNet is running.  

I open the 0 menu and select the file at the bottom, then hit Sign and Publish and it throws that error from up above.

As a note, line 10898 is the very last line in the file, and column 3 is the space right after the closing bracket. }

>the file DID register as "okay" in my terminal window, and 08chan prompted me to sign and publish it.
>Upon doing so it took a long time, suggesting it was processing the large file.
>The processing and updating of 1/1 Peers did NOT error.
>I have manually confirmed that the file did NOT revert itself.


Edit:  I just triple-checked the file and published it again.  This time it updated 5/5 peers.  No errors.  Correct file.  Lets see what happens.
I think its safe to test.

posts.subject: Administrator here.
posts.body:
>>301d33e0-d13b-4961-b05d-45730bf48132

>Confirm that new 08chan certs are not able to post.

That's 3/4 of the way there.  Are you downloading content from old certs or no?

posts.subject: Administrator here.
posts.body:
>>04f11c58-53c8-42f6-925b-3b18059cb212
Each client checks for a valid signature before downloading and displaying.  Someone would have to crack our hash in order to spoof posts in that manner, and its a bitcoin hash AFAIK.  Probly not going to happen.

posts.body:

posts.subject: Posting Errors Fixed!
posts.body:
Huzzah!

If you're still having problems, like an error your message is over 0 bytes, get a new IP address and delete your users.json file from the main data folder.  Restart Zeronet and go get a fresh ZeroID, update and start posting.

posts.subject: Administrator here.
posts.body: Once we've 100% verified that this works, I'll edit the site disclaimer on the main page to explain getting a ZeroID and how to post.

If you're on Linux, what does your terminal output say when you try to post there?  

Edit:  I just tested posting there with both ZeroID and whitelisted certs and both published like they should.  Try letting it download some more and then go into your 0 menu and hit "rebuild database" and see if that helps.

posts.subject: Administrator here.
posts.body:
>>e8ef4b0c-f23d-40dc-a16b-08332b3ca3b0

VPN is faster and what I usually use.  Any connections you make appear to be coming from the last node in the VPN network instead of your own IP address.  VPNs are usually commercial enterprises, meaning they have more bandwidth and faster speeds.

A simple way to think about TOR is a free, peer-to-peer VPN with more encryption, that also makes it slower.

posts.subject: Administrator here.
posts.body:
We've finally fixed the posting errors between 08chan certs and ZeroID certs.  See the announcement thread on /pol/ for details, but the short version is that you guys who did the millchan update will need to uncheck "this is my site" and then do a full update, including "check files" from the ZeroHello menu, to get it.  Copy/pasting the file from the aforementioned thread MAY work instead, but I can't guarantee it.

Godspeed.  We're back, bitches.

posts.subject: Administrator here.

posts.subject: Administrator here.
posts.body:
>>cbd3eff7-95ac-4dff-a802-2d566469b814
>But that might just be because he's afraid of fucking up and breaking the site.

Bingo.  /tech/ anons who have done the millchan update on their native systems have reported massive slowdown and other problems that I really don't want to foist on the whole userbase.  Now that posting is fixed, the next goal is parsing millchan's data for their TOR image fix and implementing it.

Don't get too envious of Millchan.  Their current model is actually pseudo-centralized - what they call a "merger" system, and it apparently gives board owners the kind of moderating powers they'd have on a normal website.  i.e. the ability to actually remove and censor content.  That's a hard no.  Implementing QoL features onto this site's backbone will be slower, but we're going to keep it self-moderated and uncensorable.

>>a89320af-f6e1-4b4b-ac48-e54258372698

Its okay anon.  People are coming back now that posting is fixed - all the top boards are a lot more active today.

Its nice to see everyone showing up.  I've been lurking the other bunkers as well and things seem to be mostly stable, just with everyone talking and waiting for the main site to come back.

posts.subject: A Project For the Experts
posts.body:
Now that posting is fixed across 08chan and ZeroID certs, we're moving on to the next issue:  Fixing broken image uploads from the TOR browser.  While doing research earlier, I came across the Millchan dev's (the site we took our core code from) git repo on Gitgud.  He has a section specifically dedicated to fixing the TOR posting issue:

https://gitgud.io/millchan/Millchan/commit/27b6f9365e9d2cbaf07b2316c49af757869e68d6

The current project is to figure out the proper implementation schema that won't cause issues with the current site.  Users here and elsewhere who have done the full Millchan "patch" have variously reported heavy slowdown and other problems, and we'd like to avoid that by only implementing the fixes that we need in a piecemeal fashion instead of trying to copy their site.

Any help getting this right on the first try would be greatly appreciated!

posts.subject: Administrator here.
posts.body:
I have a lead on fixing TOR image posting.  Take a look:

https://gitgud.io/millchan/Millchan/commit/27b6f9365e9d2cbaf07b2316c49af757869e68d6

Seems the Millchan dev has a whole section of his Git repo dedicated to this exact problem.  My question is how to implement it properly?  I cloned the repo already, but we don't want to clone millchan's code because its going to cause problems.  We need JUST this section.  Thoughts and input are welcome.

posts.subject: Administrator here.
posts.body:
>>da771938-338f-4dcb-b80d-285d010fe8c3
>The kind YOU have on the whole of 08chan, retard.

I'm aware.  I'm still tossing back and forth the idea of outright shredding the master key when the site work going on is effectively "finished."  On the one hand, we'd never be able to update again or fix any new bugs that might suddenly appear.  On the other, even with a literal gun to my head and me really wanting to, I couldn't do fuckall to change this place, and I really like that option.

posts.subject: Administrator here.
posts.body:
>>5c3ee8e8-95c8-4e35-aec8-8cd6691297a3

No, I've done nothing to the index.

From what I researched today, updating the code piecemeal is going to be extremely difficult.  It ''appears'' that Millchan changed their entire file structure to accommodate their new additions.  We may end up looking at an all-or-nothing choice.  But if we have our own hub, it should be relatively trivial to disable the merger mechanics that grant moderator powers.  That then leaves the question of "will the site still work for everyone?"

I want everyone to take plenty of time thinking about it and maybe testing the millchan patch that /tech/ made.  Is potentially breaking what we have worth it for a chance at TOR images and the extra functionality offered?

That seems to be the controlling file.  Apology if I seem a bit dumb at the moment, but I'm running on a couple hours of sleep and not feeling so hot.

posts.subject: Administrator here.
posts.body:
==LET'S TALK ABOUT WHAT AN UPDATE WOULD ACTUALLY ENTAIL.==

Assuming I update the master and push the update, a big question I have is whether everyone will have to rebuild their databases separately in order to make use of it, and how we inform people of this.

A spammer attacked the site and forced a change in the ID system that broke posting for a lot of people.  Its fixed now, but a lot of the affected people left.

There's still a bunch of us here, at least.

posts.subject: Administrator here.
posts.body:
>>6f2007c1-6161-4be2-a3dd-f4ffe0677983

Indeed.  I'm looking at a major patch possibly tomorrow.

>>5256da18-bbad-466a-b221-97f7feded544

Sort of correct.  You can only have one ZeroID per IP.  08chan certs can be generated without limit, which is what the spammer used to attack us.  By switching to IP-limited IDs it stopped the spam, at the cost of getting an ID becoming a little harder.

posts.subject: Administrator here.
posts.body:
>>35a915b3-84eb-49e6-a2e1-fdf025d542c7
We could, but part of the goal is to improve ease of use for new people.  Having new people automatically load the correct version of the site without having to manually install stuff after the trouble of getting here is, IMO important.

Besides, a lot of people have been clamoring for an official fix since the site became active.  I don't want to disappoint them.

posts.subject: Administrator here.
posts.body:
>>3802a14e-c3a5-436f-b2d2-2852dcbdc82e

We should be able to fix this in the CSS after the fact.  The big issue is fixing image posting over TOR for everyone ASAP.

Only requiring a browser restart is good.  Between here and /pol/ unless someone gives a major reason not to, I'm planning on implementing the update tomorrow.  So far tests have been 99% positive, with minor issues fixed after a DB rebuild or a fresh install of ZeroNet.
